front.title: TACACS+ TLS Support
front.workgroup: Operations and Management Area Working Group

abstract.t: The TACACS+ Protocol provides device administration for routers, network access servers and other networked computing devices via one or more centralized servers. This document, a companion to TACACS+ protocol, adds Transport Layer Security (TLS) support and deprecates former inferior security mechanisms.

note.title: Requirements Language
note.t: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "NOT RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in BCP 14 when, and only when, they appear in all capitals, as shown here.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: The TACACS+ Protocol provides device administration for routers, network access servers and other networked computing devices via one or more centralized servers. The protocol carries authentication, authorization and accounting information for TACACS+ clients. While this information is highly sensitive, TACACS+ lacks modern and/or effective privacy, integrity, and authentication of the connection and network traffic between the server and client.

The existing privacy, integrity, and authentication mechanisms of TACACS+ are extremely weak. The Security Considerations section of TACACS+ Protocol adequately describes this and will not be repeated.
To address these flaws, this document updates the TACACS+ Protocol to support TLS authentication and encryption, and deprecates the use of its former mechanisms.

section.title: Technical Definitions
section.t: The Technical Definitions section of TACACS+ Protocol is fully applicable here and will not be repeated.
This refers to a Server or a Client.

section.title: Deprecation of TACACS+ PSK and Encryption
section.t: The original TACACS+ draft specified a form of encryption and Peer authentication using a pre-shared key that is wholly inadequate by modern standards and is diminutively referred to as data obfuscation in TACACS+ Protocol. The introduction of TLS PSK and certificate Peer authentication and TLS encryption to TACACS+ obsolesces these former mechanisms and so are hereby deprecated. Along with them, the TAC_PLUS_UNENCRYPTED_FLAG flag in the TACACS+ header, the least significant bit (LSB) of the flags field, is also deprecated.

Peers compliant with this document and using TLS should set the TAC_PLUS_UNENCRYPTED_FLAG flag in the Packet header. A Peer that receives a Packet without the flag set, should immediately terminate the TCP connection.

section.title: Security Considerations
section.t: This document improves the privacy, integrity, and authentication of the connection and network traffic between the TACACS+ servers and clients by adding TLS support. This does not in itself protect the server nor clients; the operator and equipment vendors have a role. That role is to diligently follow current best practices for maintaining the integrity of network devices and selection of TLS key and encryption algorithms.

section.title: IANA Considerations
section.t: IANA is requested to allocate a new well-known TCP port number fore "tacacss", described as "TACACS over TLS/SSL".
